author: Special Correspondent
text:
One lakh devotees expected to visit the temple

The Mahakumbabhishekam of the Arulmigu Kapaleeswarar Temple in Mylapore will be held from 8.30 a.m. to 10 a.m. on April 3. Works including painting of the seven-tier Rajagopuram, renovation and painting of the 14 vimanas (domes) above the sanctum sanctorums have been completed.

Along with free darshan, special tickets priced at Rs. 100 also will be available on that day when over one lakh devotees are expected to visit the temple.

D. Cauvery, Executive Officer of the temple told reporters on Saturday that all arrangements have been made keeping in mind the safety of the devotees.

The temple’s Thakkar P. Vijayakumar Reddy has sponsored the expenses for the yagasalai, and homams to be performed for the Kumbabhishekam.

The big temple car, four small temple cars, 45 wooden vahanams and the palanquins that carry the 63 Saivaite Saints (Nayanmars) have been restored with donations from devotees.
title: Mahakumbabhishekam of Kapali temple on April 3
